company.name: ARC Centre of Excellence for Nanoscale BioPhotonics

profile_positions.company: ARC Centre of Excellence for Nanoscale BioPhotonics
profile_positions.description: With the Nurture Environment Committee we promote and foster an inclusive environment within the CNBP where people feel respected and valued so they can perform at their best.
profile_positions.title: Member of the Nurture Environment Committee

profile_positions.company: ARC Centre of Excellence for Nanoscale BioPhotonics
profile_positions.title: Associate Scientist

profile_positions.description:
Atherosclerosis | Development of cell assays and animal models | Histology | PCR&Western blot | Molecular imaging | Novel drug testing | Interdisciplinary collaborations
I am responsible for the design and execution of a research project aimed to test and validate existing, and new, targeted, fumarate-based drugs for the prevention and treatment of atherosclerosis. Besides, I am involved in a project that aims to identify new microstructural and molecular markers that will improve the prediction of atherosclerotic plaque destabilization. For this, we use a novel, miniaturized, multi-modal fluorescence & optical coherence tomography (OCT) microcatheter developed by the CNBP, University of Adelaide.
profile_positions.title: Postdoctoral Researcher, NHI fellow

profile_positions.description:
Received my PhD title with the distinction Cum Laude (with honors).

Cardiovascular | Invasive imaging | (Immuno)histochemistry | Biomechanics | Lipoproteins | Animal models | Interdisciplinary collaborations | Student supervision | Science communication

Special focus: assessing the role of shear stress and wall stress on atherosclerotic plaque development by using different invasive- and non-invasive imaging techniques in a large animal model.
profile_positions.title: PhD Candidate

profile_positions.description: With the COEUR researchschool committee, we represent the interests of all cardiovascular PhD students based at the Erasmus MC. We organize different activities like workshops and excursions to companies to stimulate networking, to learn the 'soft' research skills and to explore your future career. Every year we organize the COEUR day which is always centralized around a specific theme. During this day, we bring both PIs and PhD students together to stimulate making new connections and set up possible collaborations between departments within the COEUR research school.
profile_positions.title: Chairman of the COEUR Researchschool committee

company.name: St. Antonius Hospital Nieuwegein, The Netherlands

profile_positions.company: St. Antonius Hospital Nieuwegein, The Netherlands
profile_positions.description: Continuation of my previous internship research on the value of P-selectin as a platelet activation marker in elective or acute PCI patients
profile_positions.title: Student Researcher

profile_positions.company: St. Antonius Hospital Nieuwegein, The Netherlands
profile_positions.description:
Subject: Research on different techniques measuring platelet function and activity in patient groups undergoing an acute or elective PCI procedure. Special focus on the possible predictive value of measuring P-selectin levels on blood platelets.
Main activities: drawing blood from patients, performing platelet activity tests, switching patients to different types of anti-platelet medication and performing database analysis on the gathered data.
profile_positions.title: Intern department Cardiology

profile_positions.description:
Subject: Study the influence of blood flow on the organisation of atherosclerotic lesions. 
I worked on a project where 3D histological reconstructions of murine carotid vessels are being combined with shear stress maps derived from μCT and ultrasound data to enable the construction of an overlay between different shear stress patterns and changes in plaque characteristics over time. I gained experience on murine surgery, histology and immunohistochemistry,  isolation and culturing of primary cell lines, rtPCR, gel elektrophoresis and performing computational transcription factor analysis.

Received the Van Wijck-Stam Caspers price for this project.
profile_positions.title: Intern department Bioengineering

profile_positions.description:
Subject: Finding new therapeutic(s) (targets) for stimulation of neovascularisation in peripheral artery disease. 
The focus of my project was to discover the role of the immune inhibitory CD200- pathway in arteriogenesis. Thereby we used a new quantitative flow cytometric analysis method for assessment of local immune cell infiltration. During this internship, I gained experience on a great variety of techniques: murine surgery techniques, histology, immunohistochemistry, ex vivo blood stimulation experiments, FACS and quantitative rtPCR.
profile_positions.title: Intern Experimental Cardiology

profile_positions.description: Continued my internship work on the ELISAs to determine the hFABP and Troponine-I levels over time after an acute myocardial infarction.
profile_positions.title: Research Assistant department Experimental Cardiology

profile_positions.description:
Subject: Growth factor therapy in an acute myocardial infarction. 
I mainly performed ELISA test on Troponin-I and hFABP plasma levels and wrote a literature overview to determine the optimal parameters for growth factor therapy in MI.
profile_positions.title: Intern Experimental Cardiology

volunteer_experiences.description: With an enthousiastic group of students from a students badminton club, we are working on a social project at a primary school for special educational needs children in an underprivileged area in Utrecht. We guide the children to set up a project which is meant to improve the outlooks and socials aspects of their neighborhood with the main focus on mutual respect. Besides teaching mutiple lessons in the class, we also take the children for a badminton session to stimulate social interactions and group bonding. The final product of this project, made possible with support from the district office, is a wall painting on one of the school walls. This painting, visible for every passer-by, shows what the children regard as the ideal peacefull neighbourhood.

The ISBT (international students badminton tournament) committee organizes an annually recurring tournament for international students. Besides badminton, the setup of this tournament encourages meeting new people and making new contact from all over Europe. As committee member I have been mainly responsible for sponsoring and promotion, arranging and planning all volunteering work and organizing the scenario- and time-schedules for the tournament days.
